Although basic biochemical and physiological principles dictate that it is the activity of a given enzyme that is important with respect to its function, two kinetic parameters determine the activity of enzyme at given substrate concentration; i.e. limiting rate V max (= k cat Â·[E] T ) which depends on turnover number and enzyme active sites concentration, and the Michaelis constant K m which is not concentration dependent characteristics of an enzyme. However, the values of K m are associated with polymorfic forms
